text: Arthur Melville "Art" Benedict (March 31, 1862 – January 14, 1948) was a National League second baseman. Benedict played for the Philadelphia Quakers in the season. In three career games, he had 4 hits in 15 at-bats, with 4 RBIs. He batted and threw right-handed. Benedict was born in Cornwall, Illinois and died in Denver, Colorado. ==External links== *Baseball Reference.com page * Category:1862 births Category:1948 deaths Category:Philadelphia Quakers players Category:Major League Baseball second basemen Category:Baseball players from Illinois Category:19th-century baseball players Category:People from Henry County, Illinois
title: Art Benedict
